content.title: Maulana Azad National Fellowship For Minority Students
content.details: Maulana Azad National Fellowship For Minority Students was launched in 2009 by the Ministry of Minority Affairs for providing financial aid to students for their higher studies. The objective of the Fellowship is to provide five year fellowships in the form of financial assistance to students from minority communities, notified by the Central Government, to pursue M. Phil and Ph.D.
benefits: Fellowship in Science Humanities and Social Science: ₹ 31,000/- p.m. for initial two years (JRF), and ₹ 35,000/- pm. for remaining tenure (SRF)
Fellowship in Engineering & Technology: ₹ 31,000/- p.m. for initial two years (JRF), and ₹ 35,000/- pm. for remaining tenure (SRF)
Contingency for Humanities & Social Sciences: ₹ 10,000/- p.a. for initial two years, and ₹ 20,500/- p.a. for remaining tenure
Contingency for Sciences, Engineering & Technology: ₹ 12,000/- p.a. for initial two years, and ₹ 25,000/- p.a. for remaining tenure
Escorts/Reader assistance (All subjects): ₹ 2,000/- p.m. in cases of physically and visually handicapped candidate
eligibility: The applicant should be a part of one of the minority communities (Buddhist, Christian, Jain, Muslim, Sikh, or Zoroastrian (Parsi)).
Applicant must qualify the UGC-NET or Joint CSIR-UGC NET examination.
If applicant does not complete his/her research work during the period of fellowship shall not be eligible to apply again under this scheme.
If applicant completely or partially availed any fellowship earlier shall also not be eligible for fellowship under this scheme.

Employees of any university, college, educational institution, or central, state, or union territory government are not eligible for fellowships, even if they are on study leave or end of life (EOL) leave to pursue an M.Phil. or Ph.D. course
exclusions: Only 2 students per family are allowed to take benefit of this scheme.

Employees of any University/ College/ Educational Institutional/ Central/ State/ UT Government shall be excluded from availing fellowship, even if they are on Study Leave or EOL to pursue the M.Phil./Ph.D. course.
documents_required: At the end of every three months, the fellow shall submit a 'Continuation Certificate' in the prescribed proforma.
After completion of one year of the award of fellowship, the concerned fellow/awardee shall submit and present its Progress Report in the proforma prescribed by the UGC.
The Fellow/awardee shall also submit and present accounts of contingency grants in the proforma prescribed by the UGC.
Fellow/awardee shall submit and present its HRA Certificate in the prescribed proforma.

faqs.question: Who can apply for fellowship under MANF scheme?
faqs.answer: The candidate should belong to one of the minority communities notified under Section 2 (c) of the National Commission for Minorities Act, 1992, viz., Buddhist, Christian, Jain, Muslim, Sikh, Zoroastrian (Parsi).

faqs.question: Is it mandatory to appear in the UGC-NET/Joint CSIR-UGC Test for MANF Fellowship?
faqs.answer: Yes, this fellowship is awarded only through UGC-NET / Joint CSIR-UGC Test. Candidate should apply for both i.e. JRF and Eligibility for Assistant Professor.

faqs.question: What is the period for availing the award of MANF through UGC-NET/Joint CSIR-UGC Test?
faqs.answer: For the candidates who had already taken admission into M.Phil / Ph.D while applying for the concerned UGC-NET/ Joint CSIR-UGC Test, the validity period of the offer is three months w.e.f. the date of issue of Award letter.

faqs.question: Where will the MANF qualified candidate get the Award Letter?
faqs.answer: The UGC uploads the Award Letters on its website: www.ugcnetonline.in. The qualified candidates can download their Award Letters from there.

faqs.question: Can I be considered for MANF if I have not declared my minority status while applying for UGC-NET/ Joint CSIR-UGC Test?
faqs.answer: The result of MANF is prepared on the basis of information provided by the candidate in his/her Online Applying Form for UGC-NET/ Joint CSIR-UGC Test.

faqs.question: How many Fellowships can be availed by the candidate at a time?
faqs.answer: A scholar is eligible to receive only one fellowship at a time.

faqs.question: What is the mode of selection?
faqs.answer: Community-wise selection of scholars at the national level will be done on the basis of their pro-rata population.

faqs.question: What is the duration of fellowship?
faqs.answer: For M.Phil: Maximum duration is 2 years or date of submission of dissertation, whichever is earlier. For Ph.D.: Maximum duration is 5 years or date of submission of Ph.D. thesis, whichever is earlier.

faqs.question: What is the rate of fellowship?
faqs.answer: JRF- Rs.31,000/- p.m. for initial two years SRF- Rs.35,000/- pm. for remaining tenure HRA and Contingency is also paid as per guidelines of scheme.
